ygData.subject: Re: Rogue deciders
ygData.msgSnippet: Not even Cutthroat knows what they re up to - and he used to be one of them, Devilcat says grimly.  Ah, here we are.  The Maximal base is coming into view

"Not even Cutthroat knows what they're up to - and he used to be one 
of them," Devilcat says grimly.  "Ah, here we are."  The Maximal base 
is coming into view in the distance.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
<wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Yggdrasil shook his huge tree trunk that passed as his head.
> 
> Yggdrasil: They can't be aliens to know us so much. Besides, even an
> alien transformer race would not have spark signatures. It's unique 
to
> the cybertron ones. It's never been detected or replicated anywhere
> else. The Tripredacus are something. They don't seem totally Preds,
> and let's not speak of Maximals. What could their goal be?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > Devilcat considers for a moment before making his reply: "Despite 
> > being branded as terroists, the Rogues have many contacts both on 
and 
> > off Cybertron.  I heard one story about a group of Predacons from 
> > different origins than the main batch, but when I went back to 
> > confirm it, the fellow who told me had been assassinated.  If the 
> > Tripreds are indeed these aliens he spoke of, they've been very 
> > careful to hide themselves."
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Yggdrasil: So they seem to be organized and fearsome... But how 
can 
> > we
> > > not have known about them? I'm not a member of the intelligence
> > > services, but I have my contacts, and there was never any 
mention of
> > > the Tripredacus... We were only aware of some divergent Predacon
> > > movements... Oh by the Matrix...
> > > 
> > > He suddenly realized that somehow, the Tripredacus had 
influenced 
> > the
> > > Predacons. And that meant that whatever the Tripreds did, the 
Preds
> > > would do it.
> > > 
> > > Yggdrasil: I don't know the extent of it, but the Tripreds are 
the
> > > Predacon leaders.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> > > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > "It's an old story," Devilcat growls.  "It started when one 
of 
> > our 
> > > > operations uncovered a plot to take over Cybertron.  The job 
went 
> > > > sour, and we barely got out alive.  We consider the Maximal 
> > Elders 
> > > > too faint of heart to lead, but the Tripredacus are the 
opposite 
> > > > extreme.  Things snowballed from there, and eventually one of 
us 
> > > > almost bought the farm offing one of their generals.  He got 
out, 
> > but 
> > > > spent over a week in the CR.  This was the gravest injury 
we'd 
> > > > suffered to date, and it got us fighting mad."
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > > > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Yggdrasil: I'm right behind you.
> > > > > 
> > > > > He transforms to his Tree mode and starts walking forward.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Yggdrasil: If I may ask, why all that animosity against the 
> > > > Tripredacus?
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 
<cardhead649@y...>"
> > > > > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > > > "Naturally."  Devilcat transforms to his beast mode, a 
lion 
> > with 
> > > > > > slightly oversized talons and bat-like wings.  "Follow 
me."  
> > He 
> > > > lopes 
> > > > > > off northward.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic 
<wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > > > > > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > Yggdrasil follows outside. Soon, he would know what had 
> > become 
> > > > of 
> > > > > > his
> > > > > > > cousin, Talos.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Yggdrasil: Are you coming with me to negotiate, 
Devilcat?
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 
> > <cardhead649@y...>"
> > > > > > > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > "Very well, Envoy," Devilcat says with a 
smile.  "I'll 
> > show 
> > > > you 
> > > > > > the 
> > > > > > > > way to the Maximal base.  The rest of you, stay put - 
and 
> > be 
> > > > > > ready to 
> > > > > > > > go at a moment's notice."
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > The Rogue commander leads the way outside.  He knows 
full 
> > > > well 
> > > > > > the 
> > > > > > > > objections his fellows would raise if he gave them 
the 
> > > > chance; 
> > > > > > until 
> > > > > > > > an alliance is officially made, the Maximals are 
still 
> > > > enemies, 
> > > > > > and 
> > > > > > > > going alone into an enemy camp is dangerous.  But 
it's a 
> > risk 
> > > > > > he's 
> > > > > > > > not prepared to shrug off onto someone else, and if 
the 
> > > > Maximals 
> > > > > > are 
> > > > > > > > to put their trust in the Rogues, they must be shown 
the 
> > > > Rogues 
> > > > > > are 
> > > > > > > > willing to trust them.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic 
> > <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > > > > > > > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > Yggdrasil thinks for a moment. He figures out that 
if 
> > he is 
> > > > to 
> > > > > > team 
> > > > > > > > up
> > > > > > > > > with these guys, he better cooperate now.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Yggdrasil: Consider me as a Maximal Envoy.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > He puts his huge hand on the others.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 
> > > > <cardhead649@y...>"
> > > > > > > > > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > "The Predacons can't be trusted," warns 
Gatara.  "And 
> > I'd 
> > > > > > sooner 
> > > > > > > > die 
> > > > > > > > > > than side with the Tripredacus forces.  That 
leaves 
> > the 
> > > > > > Maximals."
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > "Indeed.  Shall me make them an offer?" Devilcat 
> > invites, 
> > > > > > > > extending 
> > > > > > > > > > his hand.  One by one, the other Rogues place 
their 
> > hands 
> > > > on 
> > > > > > his, 
> > > > > > > > > > forming a loose circle.  (There's room for 
Yggdrasil 
> > to 
> > > > join, 
> > > > > > if 
> > > > > > > > he 
> > > > > > > > > > wants.)
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > "Our greatest strength has always been unity.  
I'm 
> > glad 
> > > > to 
> > > > > > see 
> > > > > > > > that 
> > > > > > > > > > still holds true." Devilcat says with a smile.
